translation.en: [man] Me too. I've never seen him this upset.
translation.ja: 僕(ぼく)もだ かなりショックを受けてた

translation.en: -[woman] I know. -[man] He's taking it hard.
translation.ja: かなりショックを受けてた

translation.en: [woman] You know what he said to me?
He said he'll never write another story ever again.
translation.ja: 物語は書かないそうよ
いらない こんなもの

translation.en: I'm gonna burn all this stupid stuff!
[woman] I'm so afraid that tonight is gonna, like, stifle him
translation.ja: “ロストボーイ” 今夜のことがトラウマになったら？

translation.en: or be this wound that haunts him.
translation.ja: 今夜のことがトラウマになったら？

translation.en: [man] He's a creative kid, but maybe we let his obsession with horror get out of hand.
translation.ja: ホラーに夢中なのは僕(ぼく)らのせいかも

translation.en: [man] I guess I can see how they could consider it a little weird.
translation.ja: 変な目で見られるのも分かる

translation.en: Maybe it would be easier if he was just more, I don't know, normal.
translation.ja: もっと普通(ふつう)だったらうまくやれる

translation.en: [man 1 on TV] It was all gonna be so perfect, Lucy…
[man 1 on TV] …just like one big, happy family.
translation.ja: 幸せな家族になれると

translation.en: [boy on TV] Great. The bloodsucking Brady Bunch.
translation.ja: ふざけるな　吸血鬼(きゅうけつき)め

translation.en: [man 1 on TV] I haven't changed my mind about that.
[man 2 on TV] I didn't invite you this time, Max.
translation.ja: マックスは呼んでない

translation.en: -[boy] Don't you touch my mother! -[Lucy] Sam, don't! No, Sam!
translation.ja: 触(さわ)るな ダメよ サム！
閉じ込(こ)められたんだ

translation.en: Let's get this over with. I'm a busy witch. Are you useful in any way?
translation.ja: 答えなさいあんた 何か役に立つ？

translation.en: Do you see them? The apartment lured them in.
translation.ja: おびき寄せられた子供たちの服よ

translation.en: they were not useful to me.
Is there anything special about you at all?
translation.ja: あんたに何か特別なものはある？

translation.en: Any reason I should let you live?

translation.ja: 怖(こわ)い話だったら書ける
怖(こわ)い話を書けると言った？

translation.en: My Nightbooks. It's where I wrote my stories.
translation.ja: ナイトブックに話を書いた

translation.en: What are you doing with these so late at night?
I was gonna burn them in the boiler room downstairs.
translation.ja: 燃やそうとしてたんだ

translation.en: Burn them? So they're not any good.
translation.ja: つまらないなら用なしね
つまらないなら用なしね 話はすごく面白いんだ

translation.en: They're good. They're very, really, really good.
translation.ja: 話はすごく面白いんだ

translation.en: The title better not be the scariest thing about them.
translation.ja: 本当に怖(こわ)いといいけど

translation.en: I'm going to need a story every night.
translation.ja: 毎晩 怖(こわ)い話を聞かせて

translation.en: The story better be good, and it better be scary,
translation.ja: つまらなかったり怖(こわ)くなかったりしたら

translation.en: or it's the last thing you'll ever do. [giggles]
How'd you get in here? -[hissing] -[Alex screaming]
[Alex] And where'd the front door go?
-[Alex] You're a kid. -[girl] And you're a genius.
translation.ja: 君 子供だ 天才ね
休暇(きゅうか)に見える？

translation.en: Hope you like peanut butter. I used to.
translation.ja: ピーナツバターは好き？

translation.en: Anything in these cabinets is off-limits.
translation.ja: ここは触(さわ)らないで

translation.en: Don't ever think Natacha won't miss this piece of popcorn. -Lenore tells her everything. -[Lenore growls]
translation.ja: 触(さわ)ればレノーアがナターシャにバラすわ

translation.en: You say cat. I say Natacha's little spy-beast.
translation.ja: ナターシャのスパイよ

translation.en: Keep up. Natacha is the witch.
translation.ja: もちろん あの魔女(まじょ)よ

translation.en: Lenore is that wrinkled, hairless thing that follows you around all day,
translation.ja: レノーアは見張り役のネコで

translation.en: She ratted me out over a stinking cup of noodles. I hate that cat.
translation.ja: 告げ口するイヤなネコよ

translation.en: Don't just stand there. Help me clean this up before Natacha gets home.
translation.ja: 片づけるのを手伝って

translation.en: I don't know where she goes or what she does, but she can go anywhere she wants.
translation.ja: さあねでも どこへでも行ける

translation.en: Talk about the ultimate passport, this apartment is it.
translation.ja: この建物がパスポートよ

translation.en: Come on. We both have work to do. I'll get you set up.
translation.ja: さあ やることがある

translation.en: The apartment travels all over the world, luring kids in.
translation.ja: 世界中で子供をさらうの

translation.en: I live in Washington. Washington, DC.
translation.ja: 私はワシントンＤＣに住んでる

translation.en: I wonder if we're still in Brooklyn.
The apartment can do two things.
It lures suckers like us in,
and it has room to hold…

translation.ja: 物を無限に入れられる

translation.en: The Empty Classroom and Other Creepy Stories.
Whispered Tales. She does like stories.
translation.ja: 魔女(まじょ)は本当に物語が好きなんだ

translation.en: I thought you said you weren't into that kinda stuff anymore.
translation.ja: あなたは興味ないんでしょ

translation.en: -I'm not. It's my friend. -Oh, it's your friend?
translation.ja: 友達が好きなんだ 友達？

translation.en: He, uh… he'd like all this stuff.

translation.ja: くだらないヤツなんだ

translation.en: -He's, like… he's really lame. -Yeah, he sounds lame.
translation.ja: くだらないヤツなんだ そうね

translation.en: Hmm. Cool. Okay, yeah. So she makes me read her a stupid scary story every night,
translation.ja: ナターシャは毎晩１話怖(こわ)い話を聞きたがる

translation.en: but she says everything in here's already been read.
She needs you, so get to work.
You heard her. She wants a scary story tonight.
translation.ja: 今夜 読む話を書くの

translation.en: Every day, write as many stories as you can.
Cut the crap. I heard you last night, talking about your Nightbook thingies.
translation.ja: ナイトブックの話なら昨日 聞こえた

translation.en: I'm over the whole writing thing.
Then you better get over getting over it and crank out some new tales,
translation.ja: いいから書かなくちゃダメ

translation.en: You'll be lucky if she kills you.
translation.ja: 殺されれば まだいい

translation.en: Forget your family. Forget your friends. Focus on being useful to Natacha.
translation.ja: ナターシャの役に立つことを考えるの
みんな 逃(に)げようとする

translation.en: Hmm. Were you purposely making me wait?
-No. I… I was doing the dishes. -Sit there.
Give me a minute to get settled. I mean, honestly!
translation.ja: 待ちなさい　準備するわ

translation.en: Do you know what happens to children who ask too many questions?
translation.ja: 質問が多い子供はどうなると思う？
ここから逃(に)げようとしたわね

translation.en: Yasmin, too, had a little rebellious streak.
translation.ja: ヤズミンも最初は反抗的(はんこうてき)だった

translation.en: But I am curious about one thing.
translation.ja: ひとつ気になることがある
なぜ書いた物語を燃やそうとしたわけ？

translation.en: [Alex] "When… when Todd's best friend Jenny died, his heart shattered into a thousand pieces."
translation.ja: トッドは 親友のジェニーが死んで絶望した

translation.en: Shattered heart? I like it already.
[Alex] "Everyone avoided the Foster Playground at night." "They all knew the legend."
translation.ja: フォスター公園にはうわさがある

translation.en: "In the hour before daylight, the dead kids would come out and play."
translation.ja: 夜明け前に子供の霊(れい)が…

translation.en: Nope. No, no, no. Sorry, nope.
translation.ja: 待って　あり得ない

translation.en: Everyone knows that ghosts haunt places that are personal to them,
translation.ja: 幽霊(ゆうれい)が公共の場に取りつかないのは

translation.en: [Alex] "Todd walks to the playground. He gets to the gate."
translation.ja: トッドは公園の入り口に着いた

translation.en: "And as soon as his foot crosses the threshold,

translation.ja: 遊び声が聞こえてきた

translation.en: "Suddenly, a boy shoots out of the slide."
"Maybe he's ten or so, dressed like a newsie from the '20s."
translation.ja: すべり台から現れてこう言った

translation.en: Rude. You could at least say hi.
Hey… hey. I… I mean… I mean hi.
I'm looking for my friend, Jenny.
[Alex] "…Todd says, while looking for any sign of her."
translation.ja: トッドは公園を見渡(みわた)した

translation.en: To find her, you have to play.
[Alex] "The newsie whistles, and half a dozen dead kids surround Todd."
translation.ja: 子供がトッドの周りに集まった

translation.en: "Their skin is deathly white. Some of their clothes date back decades."
translation.ja: 死人のように白く 昔の服を着た子もいる

translation.en: "They push Todd on a swing, higher and higher--"
Everyone knows ghosts don't have actual physical hands,
translation.ja: 幽霊(ゆうれい)が何もつかめないのは常識よ

translation.en: so they could never push him on a swing.
translation.ja: ブランコに乗せられない

translation.en: The playground is… it's an interdimensional plane,
translation.ja: 次元をこえた公園なんだ

translation.en: a mix between the spirit world and the real world.
translation.ja: 魂(たましい)の世界と現実が…

translation.en: Oh, so you're a quantum physicist now?
translation.ja: あんた 学者なわけ？

translation.en: [hesitates] "And then the children laugh, and they pull Todd to a rusty merry-go-round."
translation.ja: トッドは回る遊具に乗せられた

translation.en: "They spin him around and around, faster and faster,
translation.ja: 幽霊(ゆうれい)にスピードを上げられて

translation.en: "Then the ghosts force Todd onto a seesaw."
"He holds on tight." "Suddenly, Todd realizes what they're up to."
translation.ja: 幽霊(ゆうれい)のねらいが分かった

translation.en: "Any living child still on the playground when the sun rises
translation.ja: 夜明けに公園にいる子供は

translation.en: is cursed to remain there forever."
translation.ja: そのまま出られなくなる

translation.en: "He stumbles towards the gate, desperate to get out,
translation.ja: 必死に逃(に)げようとするが

translation.en: but his world is spinning, and he's tripping over his own feet."
translation.ja: 目が回り うまく歩けない

translation.en: "The sun's almost up. He's nearly out of time."
"All the ghost children watch in suspense." "Todd's not going to make it."
translation.ja: 逃(に)げられっこないと幽霊(ゆうれい)たちが見ていると

translation.en: "Until suddenly, someone grabs him and pulls him towards the exit."
translation.ja: 誰(だれ)かがトッドを引っ張った

translation.en: "'Jenny, I… I wanted to see you.'"
translation.ja: そして“逃(に)げて”と言った
そして“逃(に)げて”と言った “もたもたしないで”

translation.en: not stopping for a happy reunion."
"Seeing his old friend again makes Todd's heart hurt."
I miss you. I don't wanna let you go.
[Alex] "But in death, Jenny discovered something that Todd is about to learn."
translation.ja: ジェニーは死んであることを知った

translation.en: -[meows] -[distorted] Are you out of your mind? No happy endings, you fool.
translation.ja: ハッピーエンドは許されない

translation.en: Jenny… Jenny's dead. She's… she's trapped on the playground forever.
translation.ja: ジェニーはずっと公園にいる

translation.en: -It's not happy for her. -[Natacha breathing heavily]
[spluttering] Ghostly hands go on Todd's back. He… he… he glances behind him,
translation.ja: 幽霊(ゆうれい)はトッドの背中に手をのばすと

translation.en: and he's pulled into the playground.
He… he screams for help, but it's no use.
translation.ja: 叫(さけ)んでも助けは来ない

translation.en: His ghostly soul is trapped there to this very day.
translation.ja: 魂(たましい)は今も公園にいる

translation.en: [breathlessly] Happy endings are a dangerous thing.
translation.ja: ハッピーエンドは危険なの

translation.en: Did you at least like the story? I mean, until the ending?
translation.ja: 結末以外は気に入った？
作家はいつも不安がる
すごく不思議よ　作家さん

translation.en: This beautiful darkness dances inside your brain.
translation.ja: だって あんたの頭の中には 美しい闇(やみ)がある

translation.en: [sighs] I… I wanna be like everyone else.
translation.ja: 普通(ふつう)になりたい

translation.en: Uh, I had… I had trouble writing today.
It's just hard to concentrate with someone staring at me all day.
translation.ja: 視線を感じて集中できなかった

translation.en: I told you, show him the library and then get out.
translation.ja: 案内したら出ていけと言ったはずよ

translation.en: -[meows] -It is very important that he writes.
translation.ja: 物語を書くのがどれだけ大事か

translation.en: You know how important it is.
It… it wasn't her fault either.
Well, if it wasn't Yasmin's fault, and it wasn't Lenore's fault,
translation.ja: レノーアのせいでもないなら
誰(だれ )のせいだと言うの？
僕(ぼく)のせいだ　もっと頑張(がんば)る
もう邪魔(じゃま)は入らない

translation.en: I wasn't trying to get you in any kind of trouble.
translation.ja: 君を巻き込(こ)む気はなかったんだ

translation.en: Yasmin, I'm sorry. I didn't know about the "no happy endings" thing.
translation.ja: 君を巻き込(こ)む気はなかったんだ ルールも初耳だった

translation.en: Todd shouldn't have gone back for Jenny.

translation.ja: バカだわ バカじゃない友達ならそうする

translation.en: He was her friend, and that's what friends do.
translation.ja: バカじゃない友達ならそうする

translation.en: But in here? She's right, you know.
translation.ja: でもハッピーエンドは

translation.en: She wants stories? Fine. I'll give her some stories.
translation.ja: いいよ　物語を書いてやる

translation.en: Haunted by the spirit of somebody who died working at it.
translation.ja: 机を使って死んだ人の霊(れい)

translation.en: No, no, it's stupid. They're gonna think it's stupid.
translation.ja: いや バカだと思われる

translation.en: How long you been here for? Looks like a while.
translation.ja: 長くここにいるみたいだね

translation.en: How'd they get you? They got me with a piece of pie and Lost Boys.
translation.ja: 僕(ぼく)はパイと映画につられてここへ来た

translation.en: Once upon a time, Alex stared up at the ceiling.
translation.ja: 昔々 アレックスは天井を見上げました

translation.en: Then the ceiling fell on him
translation.ja: 天井が落ち 苦しみから

translation.en: and put him out of his misery.
It's the oldest book in here.
This thing's gotta be, like, a thousand years old.

translation.ja: 「子どもと家庭のための昔話集」
これ ペンの跡(あと)？
フランケンシュタイン

translation.en: "If I don't make it out of here, I need someone to know what happened,
translation.ja: “本の登場人物たちだけにでも”

translation.en: even if it's only the characters in these books."
"People said they didn't exist, but there it was."
"I followed it into this apartment, and now I'm trapped by a witch."
translation.ja: “追いかけたら魔女(まじょ)につかまった”

translation.en: "I just have to do what the witch tells me to until Mom and Dad find me."
translation.ja: “親が見つけてくれるまで従うしかない”

translation.en: "There are other kids here. Most of them are nice."
"I'm scared, but at least I'm not alone."
translation.ja: “怖(こわ)いけど独(ひと)りじゃない”

translation.en: Hey, Yasmin, do you like unicorns?
translation.ja: ヤズミンユニコーンは好き？

translation.en: Oh, I thought maybe that's how she got you.
translation.ja: それでおびき寄せられたのかと

translation.en: You're right. It's none of my business.
And I bet you weren't lured in by a stupid movie and a piece of pie.
translation.ja: 僕(ぼく)と違(ちが)ってパイでつられないよね

translation.en: What the hell is doro wat?
Chicken, onions caramelized in spiced butter, paprika, garlic,
translation.ja: チキンや玉ねぎパプリカとか スパイスで作る料理よ
スパイスで作る料理よ

translation.en: My āyatē… My grandmother and I used to make it before she died.
translation.ja: 祖母が生きてる時よく ２人で作った

translation.en: We even grew all the herbs and veggies ourselves.
translation.ja: 材料を全部 育ててね
あの においがして

translation.en: and I just so badly wanted to see my āyatē again.
translation.ja: もう一度祖母に会いたくなったの
邪悪(じゃあく)で意地悪なね

translation.en: How's that for a happy ending?
and Katie discovered that her hunch was right."
"To a vampire, blood does taste like candy."
translation.ja: 吸血鬼(きゅうけつき)にとって 血は甘(あま)い

translation.en: Everybody knows it takes two days to grow full fangs.
translation.ja: キバが生えるには丸２日かかるわ

translation.en: There's gotta be more writing from that Unicorn Girl.
translation.ja: まだ本にメモがあるはずだ

translation.en: "…but it's too late. The roller coaster plunges down the drop."
translation.ja: ジェットコースターが落下する
ジェットコースターが落下する 金属音がひびいた

translation.en: and the grim reaper's dog laughs at the carnage."
translation.ja: 死に神の犬は笑っていた

translation.en: The grim reaper doesn't have a pet.
translation.ja: 死に神にペットはいない

translation.en: "They saw their son's footprints in the snow, leading into the woods."
translation.ja: 子供の足跡(あしあと)は森に続いていた

translation.en: "Then they saw a pair of smaller footprints, teddy-bear-sized."
translation.ja: テディベアの足跡(あしあと)もとなりにある

translation.en: "And they never saw their precious son again."

translation.ja: テディベアに幽霊(ゆうれい)？

translation.en: Took me right out of the story.
Every good story hints at truth.
translation.ja: いい物語には真実が ひそんでるの

translation.en: The more truth, the more powerful the story.
translation.ja: そうすれば 力強い話になる

translation.en: From now on, get your facts straight.
translation.ja: ちゃんと理解することね

translation.en: "I don't know how long I've been here."
"I still have the necklace Mom and Dad gave me."
"I used to touch it to remember them, but I stopped."
translation.ja: “触(ふ)れるとママとパパを思い出し”

translation.en: "It made me cry." "I'm tired of crying."
translation.ja: “涙(なみだ)が出るから もうやめた”

translation.en: "I have what I need to escape tonight."
"I'm finally going to see them again, Mom and Dad."
"I wonder if they'll even know me." "Can people forget their kids?"
translation.ja: “親は自分の子供を忘れられる？”

translation.en: You did not just throw a book at me!
Uh, no. You just surprised me. I dropped it.
translation.ja: 驚(おどろ)いて落としたんだ

translation.en: Hey, Yasmin, wait until you see what I found.
translation.ja: ヤズミン見せたいものがある

translation.en: Yeah. Sunlight is bad for magical plants.
translation.ja: 魔法(まほう)の植物は日光に弱い
ほとんどが薬の材料よ

translation.en: Enough questions. Help me with this.
I watered the vine with rat's blood instead of bat's blood.
translation.ja: シュレッダーがつるに卵を産みつけたの

translation.en: Now, Shredder eggs are growing on it. If one of them hatches,
translation.ja: シュレッダーがつるに卵を産みつけたの 卵がかえれば菜園を破壊(はかい)される

translation.en: it can destroy the night nursery, and Natacha will kill me.
translation.ja: 卵がかえれば菜園を破壊(はかい)される

translation.en: -[Yasmin] I'm taking care of it, Lenore. -[meows]
translation.ja: 大丈夫(だいじょうぶ)だから

translation.en: [whispering] Okay. Put it gently on the ground.
translation.ja: さあ 静かに地面に置いて

translation.en: Stomp it as hard as you can.
translation.ja: 思いきり ふんづけて

translation.en: [Alex] Where's the blue mist come from? Do you make it? The mist, do you think it keeps Natacha young?
translation.ja: ナターシャの瓶(びん)の中身は若さを保つ薬？

translation.en: I mean, she's really pretty, but her books are ancient,
translation.ja: ナターシャはきれいだけど

translation.en: and the apartment looks like a granny decorated it.
I thought for sure it was gonna--
It's cutting down the Shredder eggs! Stomp on them!
[Yasmin] There it is! Don't let it get away!
We need to find it and kill it before it destroys the whole place.
translation.ja: 捜(さが)し出して殺さなくちゃ

translation.en: I'm okay. I'm okay. I'm okay.
translation.ja: 僕(ぼく)は大丈夫(だいじょうぶ)だ

translation.en: I don't know where it went. [breathes shakily]
Now let's get out of here.

translation.ja: あんたたちは 役に立たないバカな子供ね

translation.en: You've been misbehaving in my garden.
translation.ja: 私の菜園で問題を起こした

translation.en: This will hurt you far more than it hurts me. [chuckles]
translation.ja: 痛い思いをさせてやるわ
お願い　話を聞いて

translation.en: [Natacha] And I would let you if I cared.
translation.ja: どうでもいいから聞かない

translation.en: Do try to keep your eyes open.
I would hate to have to start over.
[distorted] Can't you do anything right? I said keep your eyes open!
translation.ja: 目を開くこともまともにできないの？

translation.en: I begged Yasmin to take me to the nursery.
I thought the creepy plants might help me think of something cool to write about.
translation.ja: 話のネタがうかぶと思ったんだ

translation.en: She made me promise not to touch anything, but I did.
translation.ja: 僕(ぼく)が勝手に植物を触(さわ)った

translation.en: That is very brave of you, Storyteller,
translation.ja: 勇気があるわね　作家さん

translation.en: to lie right to my face.
translation.ja: 私にウソをつくとはね

translation.en: If I didn't need you to clean up the mess, I would've.
translation.ja: でも掃除(そうじ)させなくちゃ
ヤズ 大丈夫(だいじょうぶ)？

translation.en: I'm sorry I got you involved.
From now on, you help yourself. I'll help myself.
translation.ja: おたがい自分を守りましょう

translation.en: [spluttering] Yas, we can get out of here, together.
translation.ja: ヤズ 協力すればここから逃(に)げられる

translation.en: Get… get off me! Get off me! Get off!
translation.ja: やめろ　僕(ぼく)から離(はな)れろ！

translation.en: No! No! No! No! No! No! No!
-[Alex] Watch out. -[Lenore meows] Lenore's here somewhere.
translation.ja: 気をつけて　レノーアがいる
ケガしてる ひと晩じゅう ここに？

translation.en: -You've been here all night? -Yeah, all night. [sighs]
translation.ja: ひと晩じゅう ここに？ ずっといた

translation.en: I made this. It'll help with the scrapes and cuts.
translation.ja: これを作ったの　傷(きず)に効くわ

translation.en: It's a kind of aloe from a harpy plant, some dried corpse-hair vine.
translation.ja: 怪物(かいぶつ)の木や死人のつるを使った
いい感じだよ　ありがとう

translation.en: Look what Yas made for us.
I… I… I don't have any stories.
What do you mean you don't have any? You said you had a bunch of them.
translation.ja: たくさんあるんでしょ

translation.en: I did, but a Shredder, it got into my room.
translation.ja: シュレッダーが部屋に出た

translation.en: And I killed it, but it destroyed all of my Nightbooks, except for this one.
translation.ja: ナイトブックをやられて残ったのはこれだけ

translation.en: I was reading to Natacha from those Nightbooks.
translation.ja: ずっとノートから怖(こわ)い話を読んでた

translation.en: I've got nothing now. I… I have to escape. I have no choice!
translation.ja: ずっとノートから怖(こわ)い話を読んでた もう逃(に)げるしかない

translation.en: There are two ways out. The front door where you came in and the back door--
translation.ja: ドアは正面と裏口の２つだけ

translation.en: The back door! It goes outside. I saw Natacha go through there. There's--
translation.ja: ナターシャは裏口から外に出てた

translation.en: But Natacha's the only one that has the keys to that door.
translation.ja: 鍵(かぎ)はナターシャが持ってる

translation.en: You need to get over this escape nonsense and write something.
translation.ja: それよりも物語を書いて
ナターシャにバレて僕(ぼく)は殺される

translation.en: -I'll be useless to her. She'll kill me. -She won't just kill you.
translation.ja: ナターシャにバレて僕(ぼく)は殺される 殺すだけじゃない

translation.en: Eli, Little Hwan, Claire, and me.
translation.ja: イーライ ホワン クレアそして私よ

translation.en: Hwan was too young, but the rest of us took turns reading to Natacha.
translation.ja: 順番に怖(こわ)い話を読んでた

translation.en: Afterwards, we'd all huddle together at night
translation.ja: 夜になると みんなで―
脱出(だっしゅつ)を夢見た

translation.en: Last night, I almost joined them.
One day, the kitchen sink got clogged.
translation.ja: ある日 シンクが詰(つ)まった
魔法(まほう)じゃ直せない

translation.en: That's because I blocked the pipe myself with starstell moss.
translation.ja: 魔法(まほう)が効かないコケでふさいだの

translation.en: [crying] I wanted to force Natacha to call the plumber.
translation.ja: 配管工を呼ぶと思った

translation.en: I taped a note under the sink for him to find, begging him to get help.
translation.ja: シンクの下に助けを求めるメモを貼(は)った

translation.en: Natacha found the note, didn't she?
Claire spent her last moments convincing Natacha that she did it…
translation.ja: クレアは自分がやったと言った
私を守るためにウソを
あなたがしたようにね

translation.en: [breathes shakily] I used to love writing scary stories,
translation.ja: 前は書くのが好きだった

translation.en: but then I decided to stop.
translation.ja: でも書くのをやめたんだ

translation.en: And now that I have to write…
the… the ideas won't come to me anymore.
[Yasmin] Yeah. A big, blue plastic one. Why?
-And Claire, those earrings? -[Yasmin] They were her aunt's.
translation.ja: クレアは耳かざりを？ つけてた

translation.en: There's a way out of this place.
translation.ja: 脱出(だっしゅつ)は可能だ

translation.en: -"I have what I need to escape tonight." -"Escape," Yasmin.
translation.ja: “準備はできた” 言っただろ

translation.en: "I'm finally gonna see them again, Mom and Dad."
"I wonder if they'll remember me." "Can people forget their kids?"
translation.ja: “親は自分の子供を忘れられる？”

translation.en: Unicorn Girl never took this off, and none of the kids in the cabinet are wearing it.
translation.ja: 人形はどれもこれを着けてなかった

translation.en: You're right. And if she's not in the cabinet, then--
translation.ja: 本当ね　つまりその子は…
逃(に)げた メモが あちこちに残されてるんだ

translation.en: I've been piecing together her notes. There are bits here and there.
translation.ja: メモが あちこちに残されてるんだ

translation.en: She hid them throughout the books, so in case Natacha found out--
translation.ja: いろんな本に残(のこ)して…

translation.en: She wouldn't know her full plan.
Your plan sucks. We're not gonna find this today.
translation.ja: 今日 探すのはムリよ

translation.en: You need to write a story for tonight. -Like right now. -[Alex sighs]
translation.ja: それより物語を書いて

translation.en: What do we do? It'd take, like, a thousand years to search all these books.
translation.ja: こんなの全部 探すのに1000年は かかる

translation.en: The pen marks in the old book!
translation.ja: ペンの跡(あと)があった

translation.en: Is this the original "Hansel and Gretel"?
translation.ja: ヘンゼルとグレーテル？

translation.en: No one would just eat candy off of a strange house.
translation.ja: 変な家のお菓子(かし)を食べた

translation.en: [Yasmin] It's a recipe for a sleeping potion.
translation.ja: 眠(ねむ)り薬のレシピね

translation.en: "It smells awful." "I need to figure out how to hide the stink so she'll drink it."
translation.ja: “においを消せれば薬を飲ませ”

translation.en: "I'm so close. I'll put her to sleep and steal her keys."
translation.ja: 〝眠(ねむ)らせて鍵(かぎ)を盗(ぬす)める〞

translation.en: "I wish I had magic." "I'd turn her into a toad or a snail and laugh at her all day long."
translation.ja: 〝魔法(まほう)が使えれば魔女(まじょ)をカエルに変える〞

translation.en: "Then I would turn her into a centipede and rip off her legs." "All hundred legs,
translation.ja: 〝そのあとムカデに変え脚(あし)を引きちぎる〞

translation.en: I'll keep looking. You have to write a story.
translation.ja: あなたは物語を書いて

translation.en: You're the only one who can. You've gotta buy us more time.
translation.ja: 時間をかせがなくちゃ

translation.en: I like to write scary stories?
translation.ja: 怖(こわ)い話を書いてても

translation.en: Well, they're right. You are weird.
translation.ja: 確かに あなたは変よ

translation.en: But the thing that makes you weird makes them ordinary.
translation.ja: 個性は 他の人を平凡(へいぼん)にする

translation.en: And no one likes to be ordinary. Ordinary sucks.
translation.ja: みんな平凡(へいぼん)はイヤだから

translation.en: So ordinary people are gonna try and take that away from you…
translation.ja: 人の個性を奪(うば)おうとするの
“頑張(がんば)りすぎ”とか “不気味”
でも吸い込(こ)み草はくさい

translation.en: How did she mask the smell?
[Yasmin] The only other person who would know is Natacha, but she would never tell us.
translation.ja: ナターシャが教えてくれるはずがない

translation.en: I could write a story to trick her into giving us the final ingredient of the sleeping potion.
translation.ja: 材料を聞き出せるような怖(こわ)い話を書く

translation.en: [Yasmin] You know what happens if she figures out what we're up to?
translation.ja: バレたら大変なことになる

translation.en: [Alex] I know what happens if we don't try.
[Yasmin] What's the name of the story?
I want a story that'll make you squirm.
translation.ja: あんたが苦しむ話を聞きたい
ノートを燃やそうとした理由は？

translation.en: You thought I forgot about that, didn't you?
I was… I just… I was… [sighs]
Uh… Oh my God. I'm so sorry. I'm so stupid.
translation.ja: ごめんなさい私ったらバカね

translation.en: Yes, you are. I've only been saying that for years. Now you get it. [sighs heavily]
translation.ja: だから何年も前からそう言ってる

translation.en: You were about to tell me to start reading.
Oh yes. Well then, what are you waiting for?
translation.ja: そうだったさっさと読んで

translation.en: [Alex] "For generations, the evil sorcerer of Quantel
translation.ja: 魔術師(まじゅつし)は子供たちに

translation.en: sent children to mine jewels from the mouth of the great monster."
translation.ja: 怪物(かいぶつ)の口から宝石を取らせてた

translation.en: [Alex] "A thousand years ago, the evil sorcerer had a chance to kill the odious beast,
translation.ja: 昔 恐(おそ)ろしい怪物(かいぶつ)を殺さずに生かした

translation.en: but instead he used a powerful potion to keep the monster unconscious,
translation.ja: 強力な眠(ねむ)り薬を使い 怪物(かいぶつ)でもうけようと考えたのだ
怪物(かいぶつ)でもうけようと考えたのだ
“恐(おそ)ろしい”？　いいわね

translation.en: [Alex] "Every morning, the sorcerer funneled his potion down the monster's fifth ear,
translation.ja: 毎朝 怪物(かいぶつ)の耳に薬を流し込(こ)み

translation.en: "The recipe was as old as time."
"Dissolved rat's bones, dry-aged widow orchid, powdered beetle shells."
translation.ja: 溶(と)かしたネズミの骨や甲虫(こうちゅう)の粉などを使う

translation.en: "But the most important ingredient, however, was bindweed."
translation.ja: 何より大事な材料はまきつき草だ

translation.en: "Bindweed was the only thing that could hide the powerful stench of the potion."
translation.ja: まきつき草なら薬のにおいを消せる

translation.en: "Without it, the rancid smell would rouse the great monster."
translation.ja: くさいと怪物(かいぶつ)が目覚めてしまう

translation.en: "But one day, the sorcerer went to harvest more bindweed,
translation.ja: ある日 魔術師(まじゅつし)が畑に行くと

translation.en: and he discovered that the entire field had withered and died."
translation.ja: まきつき草が全部かれていた
薬は くさくなった
ひどく不快で サイアクの…

translation.en: Oh, yes, yes, yes. Understood. It stinks.
[Alex] "The sorcerer would have to kill the great monster once and for all."
translation.ja: ついに魔術師(まじゅつし)は怪物(かいぶつ)を殺すことにした

translation.en: "He reluctantly raised his mighty staff to kill the beast,
translation.ja: 魔法(まほう)のつえをふり上げた時だった

translation.en: but a peasant girl came to him and promised a solution to his problem."
translation.ja: 農家の娘(むすめ)が来て言ったのだ

translation.en: I know a replacement for bindweed. Your jewel harvest can continue.
Foolish child. You know nothing of real magic.
I can prove it. And if I do, I want a bag of jewels.
translation.ja: “証明できたら宝石が欲しい”

translation.en: If it works, you will get two bags.
If not, you will give me your life.
[Alex] "The peasant girl stepped forward and poured a mysterious dark liquid into the jug."
translation.ja: 娘(むすめ)は ある液体を薬に注ぎ込(こ)んだ
くさいにおいは なくなった

translation.en: "The smell disappeared. The sorcerer couldn't believe it."
translation.ja: くさいにおいは なくなった その代わり―

translation.en: "It smelled like daisies, roses, lilacs on a spring morning--"
translation.ja: まるで春の朝にかぐバラのように…

translation.en: [Alex] "The evil sorcerer poured the potion into the monster's ear and waited."
translation.ja: 魔術師(まじゅつし)は薬を怪物(かいぶつ)の耳に注いだ

translation.en: "The beast let out a long… [in low voice] …grumble
translation.ja: 怪物(かいぶつ)は うなり声をあげ

translation.en: "Yes! But the peasant girl had removed more than just the smell from the potion."
translation.ja: でも薬から消えたのはにおいだけじゃない

translation.en: "She'd also erased all of its magic."
translation.ja: 薬の効果も消えたのだ
魔術師(まじゅつし)の薬は もう効かない

translation.en: "The peasant girl nodded to something behind him."
translation.ja: 娘(むすめ)は何かに合図をした

translation.en: [Alex] "The eyes of the great monster were open."
translation.ja: 怪物(かいぶつ)の目が開いたのを見て
魔術師(まじゅつし)は叫(さけ)んだ

translation.en: [Alex] "The peasant girl watched it all, smiling."
translation.ja: 娘(むすめ)は笑って見ていた

translation.en: "The evil sorcerer had sent her baby brother into that cave,
translation.ja: 娘(むすめ)の弟は宝石を取りに行かされ

translation.en: "The peasant girl cared nothing about jewels." "She got what she wanted, revenge."
translation.ja: 娘(むすめ)のねらいは復しゅうだったのだ
娘(むすめ)がその場を去る時 怪物(かいぶつ)は

translation.en: as the monster's sharp teeth chomped down on the shrieking sorcerer,
translation.ja: 娘(むすめ)がその場を去る時 怪物(かいぶつ)は 魔術師(まじゅつし)を食べていた
魔術師(まじゅつし)は殺されたのだ

translation.en: "Just as the peasant girl thought she'd gotten away with it all,
translation.ja: 娘(むすめ)が安心したその時だった

translation.en: a black shadow loomed over her."
"It was the monster's giant foot, right above her." -"Splat." -[meows]
translation.ja: そして怪物(かいぶつ)は娘(むすめ)をふみつぶしたのだ

translation.en: Yeah, me and Yasmin researched for hours. I know how important it is to get all the details right--
translation.ja: 正確に書くためにヤズミンと調べて…
違(ちが)う 違(ちが)う？

translation.en: Of course I made up the potion's ingredients,
translation.ja: 材料はデタラメだけど

translation.en: but I was sure that bindweed hides odors.
translation.ja: まきつき草はにおいを消すはずよ

translation.en: -I really thought we got it right. -Well, there's your mistake.
translation.ja: 正確かと その子と調べたのが間違(まちが)いね
その子と調べたのが間違(まちが)いね
まきつき草は液体の分離(ぶんり)を防ぐ
においを消すのはシナの根よ
シナの根ね　なるほど

translation.en: Is that cinaroot with an "S" or a "C"?
Tonight, we're getting out of here.
It's turning green. I can't bring this out there.
translation.ja: 緑色だ　バレちゃうよ

translation.en: Maybe the acidity of the lemonade--
We put two drops in the glass.
translation.ja: ピッチャーに２滴(てき)だけ

translation.en: -Let's put two in the pitcher. -Will it put her to sleep?
translation.ja: ピッチャーに２滴(てき)だけ 効く？

translation.en: What? I put it right here.
-Where is it? -What are you talking about?
Where is the potion? This has to happen.
Yeah, yeah. It's, uh… it's here somewhere.
translation.ja: このあたりに書いたはず

translation.en: So, um, this one is, um, called "The Cuckoo Clock."
translation.ja: この話のタイトルは「鳩時計(はとどけい)」だ

translation.en: [Alex] When Scott's parents bought the cuckoo clock at an estate sale,
translation.ja: スコットの両親が鳩時計(はとどけい)を買った

translation.en: he thought it was just another old-timey piece of junk.
translation.ja: スコットはただの時計だと思ったが

translation.en: But there was something strange about the clock.
translation.ja: その時計にはおかしな点があった

translation.en: the little cuckoo would pop out,
and, uh, Steve started to notice--
translation.ja: ある時スティーブは気づいた

translation.en: I thought you said his name was Scott.
translation.ja: スコットのはずでしょ

translation.en: So… so Scott noticed that, uh, the cuckoo
translation.ja: スコットは気がついた

translation.en: seemed to look a little bit different every time it appeared.
translation.ja: 出るたび鳩(はと)の様子が違(ちが)う

translation.en: the ones that you're supposed to be writing every day?
translation.ja: 毎日 書いてるはずよ

translation.en: -I'm sorry. I'm sorry. -Where are your new stories?
translation.ja: ごめん 物語はどこ？

translation.en: The Shredder, it got into my backpack.
translation.ja: シュレッダーが破った
シュレッダーのせいだと？

translation.en: [spluttering] Uh, it's true. It escaped from the night nursery.
translation.ja: 菜園から逃(に)げ出したの

translation.en: I'll make you the recipe. I--
Please. You can barely follow a recipe.
translation.ja: どうせレシピどおりにできないくせに

translation.en: He writes for you! You need him!
[spluttering] I'll write the best story for you!
translation.ja: 最高の怖(こわ)い話を書く
触(さわ)らないで ええ

translation.en: [Alex] Oh no. What's wrong with you?
Poor little thing. What happened to you?
translation.ja: かわいそうに 何が…

translation.en: Lenore put our potion in the bottle of mist.
translation.ja: 瓶(びん)に薬を入れてくれた

translation.en: She must've gotten a dose of the sleeping potion.
She's a prisoner, just like us.
translation.ja: この子も とらわれの身だ
ありがとう アレックスナターシャに勝った
アレックスナターシャに勝った

translation.en: How's that for following a recipe?
Wait. Where do you think it goes?
Never thought I'd see trees again.
I'm never gonna eat peanut butter ever again!
translation.ja: ピーナツバターはウンザリ

translation.en: [Alex] You can forget about pumpkin pie for me!
First food when I get back? Vanilla milkshake!
translation.ja: 帰ったらシェークを飲む

translation.en: Whoa, whoa, wait, Alex. Hold up. Hold up. Just wait a second.
translation.ja: 止まって ねえ 待って

translation.en: The door, it wasn't the way out.
translation.ja: ドアは出口じゃなかった

translation.en: -[Alex] What just happened? -[Yasmin] Maybe something spooked it?
translation.ja: 何？ 何かから逃(に)げた

translation.en: Oh my God. "Hansel and Gretel" was real.
translation.ja: ヘンゼルとグレーテルは実話だったのか

translation.en: We… we shouldn't be in here, Yas.

translation.ja: おやおや眠(ねむ)り姫(ひめ)のお目覚め？
それは別の物語だった

translation.en: The mist, that's where it comes from.
translation.ja: 瓶(びん)の中身はここから―

translation.en: who, by the way, does eat children.
translation.ja: ちなみにこの魔女(まじょ)は子供を食べる

translation.en: We thought you were the original witch. We thought the blue mist kept you young.
translation.ja: 青い薬は若返り薬だと思ってた

translation.en: I don't need the mist to keep me young. It gives me her magic.
translation.ja: これは魔女(まじょ)から魔力(まりょく)をもらうための薬よ

translation.en: I was about your age when she got me.
translation.ja: 昔 この魔女(まじょ)につかまった

translation.en: There were lots of us back then.

translation.ja: みんな 分かってた

translation.en: We knew not to get attached,

translation.ja: 魔女(まじょ)が腹をすかせたからね

translation.en: [Natacha] And then I… I had to clean the oven.
translation.ja: 私はオーブンを掃除(そうじ)させられた
魔女(まじょ)に取り入って

translation.en: Pretended to want to be like her. I became her favorite.
translation.ja: あこがれてるフリをして気に入られた

translation.en: But when I was alone, I plotted my escape.
translation.ja: でも 一人の時に逃(に)げる計画を立てた

translation.en: I would get her to trust me.
translation.ja: 魔女(まじょ)を信用させ…
眠(ねむ)り薬を使ったの

translation.en: [Natacha] I had nowhere else to go,

translation.ja: さらわれて ここに？

translation.en: [Alex] She's the one who's been shaking the apartment?
translation.ja: ゆらしてるのは魔女(まじょ)か

translation.en: [Natacha] If she doesn't get a story, we're all gonna die.
translation.ja: 怖(こわ)い話を聞かせないと私たちは死ぬ
物語で眠(ねむ)らせてるの

translation.en: Stories of fear and suffering and death are like sweet lullabies to her.
translation.ja: 恐怖(きょうふ)や苦しみの物語が子守歌なのよ

translation.en: Tell us the reason that you wanted to destroy your Nightbooks.
translation.ja: ノートを捨てようとした話よ
それは怖(こわ)い話じゃない

translation.en: All that pain and fear and sadness
translation.ja: あんたにとってはつらくて怖(こわ)い そして悲しい

translation.en: that you've been avoiding this whole time.
translation.ja: ずっと話すことを避(さ)けてた

translation.en: You think I'm a bad witch?
Just wait until she wakes up and sees you.
translation.ja: この魔女(まじょ)はもっと怖(こわ)い

translation.en: So young, so plump, so juicy--
translation.ja: あんたは うまそうで…

translation.en: [Alex] There once was a boy who… who loved to write scary stories.
translation.ja: 怖(こわ)い話を書くのが好きな男の子がいた

translation.en: Every day, on his free time, he would come up with new ways to scare his classmates.
translation.ja: 同級生を怖(こわ)がらせたくて毎日 書いてた

translation.en: But… [sighs] …they just didn't get his fascination with creepy things.
translation.ja: みんなは怖(こわ)い話の良さを理解できなくて

translation.en: To them, he was just… weird.
translation.ja: 男の子は変なヤツだと思われてた

translation.en: Except for Joshua. Josh was his best friend
translation.ja: でも親友のジョシュは違(ちが)った

translation.en: Alex finishes his latest bone-chilling tale,
translation.ja: アレックスは新作を書き上げた

translation.en: and he's excited to share it.
translation.ja: アレックスは新作を書き上げた 〝おしまい？〞 〝おしまい？〞

translation.en: Hey, you're gonna love this one.
[Alex] Alex catches up with Josh after class.
translation.ja: ジョシュに話しかけた
“今日は僕(ぼく)の誕生日パーティーだ”

translation.en: We turned the apartment into a haunted house.
translation.ja: “今日は僕(ぼく)の誕生日パーティーだ” “家を幽霊(ゆうれい)やしきにした”

translation.en: It's amazing. I've got tons of new stories ready.
translation.ja: “家を幽霊(ゆうれい)やしきにした”

translation.en: Josh talks low, not wanting the others to hear.
translation.ja: ジョシュは声をひそめて言った

translation.en: Cody's having a gaming party. His dad's getting the truck and everything.
translation.ja: “コーディーもパーティーを開く”
“今夜は僕(ぼく)のパーティーだ”
アレックスは驚(おどろ)き 傷ついた

translation.en: Alex's hope sinks. He's desperate. He says…
translation.ja: そして必死になってこう言った

translation.en: Yeah, right. Cody's my friend now too.
The way you dress, the things you like.
translation.ja: “服装もシュミも変わってる”

translation.en: "All you do is talk about your scary stories."
All right, all right. Alex, I'll see you later, okay?
The boy had written a new story about a haunted house.
translation.ja: 新作は幽霊(ゆうれい)やしきの話だった

translation.en: [crying] He, his mom, and his dad
had turned his whole apartment into that house.
translation.ja: 幽霊(ゆうれい)やしきにかざった

translation.en: They made him hate the thing he loved most.
translation.ja: アレックスは好きだったものを嫌(きら)いになり

translation.en: And they made him hate himself.
translation.ja: 自分も嫌(きら)いになった

translation.en: The real truth is, he was embarrassed to be himself,
translation.ja: 何より自分が恥(は)ずかしくて仕方なくて―

translation.en: so he decided to burn his Nightbooks.
translation.ja: ノートを燃(も)やそうとした

translation.en: He swore he'd never write another story again.
translation.ja: もう書かないと誓(ちか)ってね
変人じゃなくなると思ったんだ

translation.en: He could be normal, like Josh and his friends.
translation.ja: ジョシュや みんなみたいに普通(ふつう)になれば…
独(ひと)りじゃなくなる

translation.en: The boy lost all his friends,
so he decided to destroy that part of himself that created the Nightbooks.
translation.ja: 物語を書く自分と決別しようと決めたんだ

translation.en: Then a witch captured him. She said she liked his stories.
translation.ja: 魔女(まじょ)は男の子の物語を好きだと言った

translation.en: But being captured by her was the best thing that ever happened to me…
translation.ja: でも ここに来られてよかった

translation.en: friends who love me for who I am, not for who they want me to be.
translation.ja: ありのままを受け入れてくれた

translation.en: What have you done? You stupid children.
translation.ja: 何て おろかなことをしたの

translation.en: -[witch wheezing and grunting] -[Natacha] Oh God! Oh God!
You've been asleep here so long, the… the candy is infecting you.
translation.ja: お菓子(かし)のせいでずっと眠(ねむ)ってたのよ

translation.en: I have lived in fear of you for so long, but I am not that little girl anymore.
translation.ja: ずっとあんたを恐(おそ)れてた だけど もう違(ちが)う

translation.en: Help! We need help! Get us out of here!
translation.ja: 助けて！ ここから出して

translation.en: A witch is gonna eat us!
translation.ja: 魔女(まじょ)に食べられる

translation.en: [Yasmin] Alex, move. I've seen Natacha do this.
translation.ja: ナターシャがこうするのを見た

translation.en: We're still in my building. The apartment didn't move.
translation.ja: まだ僕(ぼく)のアパートだ

translation.en: -Do you have a plan? -Not exactly a plan, an idea.
translation.ja: 計画は？ 考えならある

translation.en: This is the worst elevator ever!
translation.ja: 最低のエレベーターだ

translation.en: We just need to make it to that boiler room.
-No! No! No! No! -No! No! No! No!
translation.ja: ダメ 閉まらないで！

translation.en: No, let… let her go. It's me you want.
translation.ja: 離(はな)せ　僕(ぼく)がねらいだろ

translation.en: "Stories about fear and death are like lullabies to her."
translation.ja: “恐怖(きょうふ)の物語が子守歌”か

translation.en: You like stories? I got stories.
translation.ja: 物語が聞きたいんだろ

translation.en: [breathes shakily] Jason couldn't decide which was stranger.
translation.ja: ジェイソンの妹は毎週 火曜日に死ぬ

translation.en: The fact that his sister died every Tuesday at 11:15
translation.ja: ジェイソンの妹は毎週 火曜日に死ぬ そして なぜか20分後に生き返る

translation.en: or that she always came back to life 20 minutes later.
translation.ja: そして なぜか20分後に生き返る

translation.en: Zachary had always thought that clowns were the scariest part of the circus. He was wrong.
translation.ja: サーカスで最も怖(こわ)いのはピエロじゃない

translation.en: I found a package on my front porch
addressed to the woman standing right behind you.
translation.ja: 送り先は後ろに立ってる女の人だ

translation.en: Who? Who was it? Who was it?
translation.ja: 誰(だれ)だ　その女の正体は？

translation.en: -The stories! -[Alex] Push her! Push her in!
translation.ja: 物語が！ 押(お)し込(こ)むんだ！
閉めて 押(お)さえろ

translation.en: -[Yasmin] Keep it shut! -[Alex] Keep her in!
So that's why they call you a tryhard?
We didn't forget about you. Come here.
[Yasmin] Maybe we should take the stairs.
[Alex] These are my friends, Lenore and Yasmin.
♪ Thou shall not die ♪ ♪ Unchain me, sister! ♪

translation.ja: 不気味さん 頑張(がんば)りすぎ

translation.en: My parents drove me up to surprise you.
translation.ja: 両親が車で送ってくれた

translation.en: -What is that? Like, your third story? -Fourth, actually.
So you could definitely use this.
translation.ja: よかった　これを使って

translation.en: [Yasmin] Check out the flowers. My next science fair project. The effect of ultraviolet black light on photosynthetic organisms.
translation.ja: 紫外線(しがいせん)が光合成生物に与(あた)える影響(えいきょう)を研究中よ

translation.en: [Alex] Still don't believe in happy endings?
translation.ja: ハッピーエンドは？ ハッピーエンドは？ 〝変なままでいて〞
〝変なままでいて〞 〝変なままでいて〞 信じ始めた
